snippet: Strikes on military warehouses and other installations in Syria appear to underscore Israel’s determination to keep advanced weapons out of Hezbollah’s hands.
abstract: Israel's airstrikes in Damascus, Syria, which focused on military warehouses and other military installations, appear to be more about Israel's determination to keep advanced weapons out of Hezbollah and Iran's hands than about bloody civil war raging in Syria.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Strikes on military warehouses and other installations in Syria appear to underscore Israel’s determination to keep advanced weapons out of Hezbollah’s hands.

headline.seo: Strikes in Syria Linked to Israel May Be a Signal to Iran
headline.main: Airstrikes Tied to Israel May Be Message to Iranians
headline.print_headline: Airstrikes Into Syria A Message To Iranians

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
